channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2024080447
item.description:
Report E-2024080447

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: WHITMORE LAKE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 19 , 2024, at 1655 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by XPO personnel in Whitmore Lake, Michigan regarding the release of GARDACID P 4354 (UN3264, Corrosive Liquid, Acidic, Inorganic, n.o.s, 8, II). Environmental Restoration contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all clean up activities. Upon the arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1 cup of material impacting a 1ft x 1ft area of the trailer floor due to a pinhole puncture. Contractors cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE, then transferred the residual material in the damaged tote into a new IBC plastic tote. The spent absorbents and cut up damaged tote were containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF as waste and staged onsite by contractors pending proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080337
item.description:
Report E-2024080337

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: WESTLAND
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A drum was being transferred to the dock at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Westland, MI when the drum fell off the pallet. Upon investigation, it was found that the pallet was damaged, as well as the drum's bung was not secure, so when the drum fell off, the bung released from the drum causing approximately 5-gallons of waste flammable corrosive liquid material to spill.

item.title: Report X-2024072141
item.description:
Report X-2024072141

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-15T15:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-26
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The wet package was discovered during the AM sort and placed in a plastic lined hazmat tote and brought to QA for inspection. Upon inspection the package was found to be a damaged hazmat and all the proper hazmat procedures were followed. Package handler 4575314 was exposed to the leaking product and skin irritation was a result. He washed his hands with soap and water and reported the incident to his supervisor.

item.title: Report X-2024080610

Report X-2024080610

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A wet hazmat package was discovered in unload and the package was placed in a plastic lined hazmat tote and brought to QA for inspection. Upon inspection the package determined to be damaged. All the proper hazmat procedures were followed. Proper hazmat loading processes should always be followed when building trailers.

item.title: Report E-2024080211
item.description:
Report E-2024080211

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-14T15:13:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-31
  • City: BYRON CENTER
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 31, 2024, at 2226 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Dayton Freight Lines personnel in Byron Center, Michigan regarding the release of Ammonium Nitrate (UN1477 Ammonium Nitrate, Potassium Nitrate, 5.1, II). Terminal personnel reported that 1 ounce was released from (1) 10lb plastic bag due to a forklift puncture and impacted the dock floor. Terminal personnel cleaned the release and staged the 5 gallon DF of waste onsite pending disposal.
